name: Conrad Koh Samui Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for 7 nights with husband and daughter, from 1/16 to 1/23. We had a fantastic time!
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: ROOM
reviews.title: Hotel Management & Future Guests - Pay attention!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was large, very modern, ample storage and beautifully decorated. Of course, the best part was the pool, great view and very clean. A few minor, minor issues:
reviews.title: Paradise in Koh Samui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lighting system is a bit confusing.
reviews.title: Truly paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The housekeeping service, although very thorough and a very friendly staff, can come very, very late in the afternoon. This is not so great if you are out for a day, hoping to return to a clean room to freshen up, only to find that it is not done up.
reviews.title: Beautiful place with stunning view but management needs serious improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights at the Conrad over Christmas and we liked it a lot. The hotel is built on a cliff with stunning views from every villa. We could sit hours looking at the ocean, watching the sunset or watching a thunderstorm unfolt.
reviews.title: a magic place !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The villas are beautiful with a big terrace, practical swimming pool (more than just a plunge pool) and a very spacious bathroom. There is a (complicated) audio/video system based on Apple TV. We had to call several times before we really understood how to operate it. I would recommend the hotel to put a manual in the room. Once you understand how it works, it is great with lots of option, a good choice of on demand movies and excellent sound quality through the Bose loudspeakers.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, service needs some improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every day, we spent a few hours in the gym. The gym is wonderful and mainly the suites upstairs are great with Ocean view, Jacuzzi and steambath. Worth the money. We experienced some therapists as being much better than others. And after 2 days, we choose the therapists we wanted.
reviews.title: I hope I could stay longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants are great with some excellent food, served in Zest and in Jahn (the 2 restaurants we tried). Breakfast is great with an "special eggs menu" and a wide choice of fresh juices. Excellent. Having breakfast outside on the terrace, overlooking the Ocean is a real treat. Jahn serves modern Thai food which we also enjoyed very much. Of course, all this comes at a price and this is what you should expect in a topclass 5 star resort as this one.
reviews.title: Wish I could have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is very isolated and you need to drive or take a boat for quite a while in order to get to the nearest city. It did not disturb us and we did not leave the resort, except with the boat to the beach. The resort does not have a beach, though 3 times a day a speedboat brings you to a deserted, very nice beach in 15 minutes (sea can be rough). Water and towels are provided by the hotel at this beach. All very nice !
reviews.title: Welcome to Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel with a nice touch of exclusivity. Villa's have a decently sized private swimming pool and the villa itself is beautifully designed. Spacious, modern and a really nice bathroom. The one thing that bothered us was the food we had for lunch/dinner at Zest. All dishes were extremely flat and flavorless. Very surprising for a country known for their spices and tasty meals. At $20 per dish Conrad needs to deliver better. The breakfast on the opposite was good, both in terms of variety and quality. Would definitely go back, but eat outside of the hotel for dinner.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with room for improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An idyllic resort perched on a hillside. The villas are all sea facing with lovely view of the ocean. The private infinity pool in every villa is indeed a selling point. The bathroom is spacious and the bed is comfortable. The service staff are friendly & helpful. The room is always tidied up every time we leave the room. After returning from dinner, the bath tub was already filled up with lukewarm bubble bath. Only issue I have is that the resort is too isolated, far away from all the party pubs and bars. No nightlife means Boring! I hope the resort can provide free transportation to those nightlife places if possible, then it would be awesome. By the way, I feel that the breakfast served is below this resort standard and rating.
reviews.title: Idyllic Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first thing you will need to realise about this resort, that it is quite isolated. It is at the furthest point of the island away from the airport, and is pretty much a resort that is stand alone, and not easy to get to anywhere without a reasonable drive.
reviews.title: Beautiful place to relax and wind down.

reviews.text: That said, the location is very stunning, with amazing sunset views, and because of the individual villa style rooms, with private swimming pool, very private. If you want a place to really just totally chill out in comfort, with a gorgeous seaside location, this is the place.
reviews.title: Wonderful view and villa BUT troubled service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and views really are spectacular, and it is lovely to be able to just dive into the pool, pretty much straight from your bedroom.
reviews.title: Idyllic Couples Retreat

reviews.text: Lovely quiet resort situated on a hillside. All villas are sea facing with wonderful views of the ocean. The wow is for the private infinity pool that comes with each villa. Staff are friendly & helpful.
reviews.title: Wow factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AS mentioned by other reviewers the resort is isolated. It is a 45 minute drive if you wanted to dine at other restaurants. Whilst the food was good at the resort it was very, very expensive to wine & dine there.
reviews.title: Idyllic but isolated resort

reviews.text: Strangely there is no actual bar to hang out in in the evening & during our 4 day stay there was no evening entertainment which was surprising as being as the resort was a long way from any night life.
reviews.title: Wonderful memory at Conrad Koh Samui
Only the view, not worth the price
reviews.text: If you looking for a very quiet relaxing place to stay then this is for you.

I think basically the hotel is what the hotel is, an idyllic but expensive and isolated resort. It's the way in which people deal with this that varies. I suspect many people, like ourselves, come on Hilton miles and hence are more cost conscious, if you can afford to pay for a room, you probably won't baulk at the cost of the rest of the things. If you are on a budget you can keep costs down by going to the Elements Spa for massages, shopping for snacks and booze at the mini mart and eating outside at the Green Ta'lay (which I found a bit disappointing given the Tripadvisor hype especially the building site location). There is also a massage place next to the mini mart where you can get a Thai Massage for $10. I just wish the resort didn't have the world's steepest hill to get in otherwise it would have been a stroll to the outside world rather than a $12 taxi ride.
reviews.title: Thought we'd died & gone to heaven

description: Conrad Koh Samui is a luxury pool villa resort located on the south western tip of the popular Thai island, designed to ensure each private pool villa enjoys glorious panoramic views of the Gulf of Thailand and its astonishing sunsets. Consisting of 80 private pool villas with one, two or three bedrooms, 3 innovative restaurants, 2 bars, a private wine cellar and destination dining, the resort provides the individualistic sense of luxury that Conrad has become known for. The award-wining spa combines international treatments and Thai spa techniques with distinctive design accents and world-class facilities to delight all of the senses.
